column4: Need some assistance with Ubuntu on a Toshiba Satellite laptop, please.

OK... here goes... I installed Ubuntu on my lappy yesterday. I thought I partitioned the HD to keep Vista, but now Vista won't show up on the boot menu when I F12 during start-up... AND Ubuntu won't recognize my wireless card.
I let Ubuntu run it's thing as default... which I thought it didn't overwrite Vista unles syou specifically told it to.
when you install something, you have to READ what it says to you. If you select an HD, the default setting is (if I remember well) to erase all on that hd and do an Ubuntu Install.
